content: bougainvillea blanket part vii big flowers base large 3d blooms rounds 85 102 designed by porzia sprovera 2025 index before you start………… …………………………………………… 3 video tutorials………………………………………………………… 4 support………………………………………………………………… … 5 recommended yarn and colors……………………………… … 5 abbreviations & appendix 5 languages ………………… 7 round 85 to 89 … …… ……………………………………… ……… 8 round 90 to 94… ………………………………………………… … 15 round 95 to 97………………………………………… ……… …… 19 round 98 to 102………………………………………… ……… …… 22 appendix 5 languages………………………………………………… 24 before you start what you need to know about this pattern crochet terms us english only in this section skill level intermedie hook 3 5 4 0 mm e g adjust to meet gauge gauge 10×10 cm / 4×4 in 20 single_crochet × 22 row 20 double_crochet × 8 row finished size of the blanket after blocking 140 x 140 cm /55 x 55 in approx format written instructions + step photos + video tutorials beginning with round 85 this part of the pattern builds the structural base for the large 3d flowers that will define the outer border of the bougainvillea blanket the rounds focus on reinforcing the sides and corners locking stitch counts and creating raised architectural edges that can support substantial floral elements you will alternate between stabilizing rounds and textured construction rounds using front-post stitches puff-based rhythms chained spaces and crossed stitch paths worked into earlier rounds special attention is given to corner integrity and even stitch distribution to keep the square flat as the fabric thickens by the end of round 102 the blanket has a clearly defined perimeter balanced corners and a strong stable base ready for the large bougainvillea blooms to be added without distortion what you ll make r85 88 spring green + jade reinforced sides and corners establishing the rhythm and spacing that will support the upcoming floral structure r89 90 jade vertical texture and puff-based accents that add depth and begin lifting the edge r91 corner flowers small 3d corner flowers that anchor the geometry and guide the outer expansion r92 96 fondant + jade structural locking rounds that thicken the edge stabilize stitch counts and strengthen the square r97 102 kelly green architectural perimeter rounds with crossed post stitches forming the final base for the large 3d blooms skills front-post work fphdc and fptr working into blo and into earlier rounds building chained arches and managing stitch distribution on a large square to keep it flat video tutorials youtube channel crochet a life porzia sprovera https //www youtube com/@crochetalife round 85 91 https //youtu be/eze90oa3ncy round 92-102 https //youtu be/k6fy1b3wyda support i don t monitor ravelry messages support channel email or comments on youtube questions or feedback mailto psprovera@gmail com recommended yarn and colours materials yarn yarn weight dk / light-3 ≈11 wpi fiber acrylic or wool/acrylic blend non-fuzzy works best for relief stitches hook 4 0 mm g-6 or size to obtain your fabric 3 5 mm for tighter appliqués optional suggested palette matches your bougainvillea series dk weight us #3
